void GLWindow::initializeGL (  )  [protected]

The following methods must be implimented in the sub class this is called when the window is created.

create our camera

Definition at line 54 of file GLWindow.cpp.

References m_camera, m_modelLOD, m_selectedModel, and m_text.

00055 {
00056 
00057   ngl::NGLInit::instance();
00058   glClearColor(0.4f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f);        // Grey Background
00059   // enable depth testing for drawing
00060   glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
00061   // enable multisampling for smoother drawing
00062   glEnable(GL_MULTISAMPLE);
00064   ngl::Vec3 eye(0,4,4);
00065   ngl::Vec3 look(0,0,0);
00066   ngl::Vec3 up(0,1,0);
00067 
00068   m_camera = new ngl::Camera(eye,look,up);
00069   m_camera->setShape(45,float(1024/720),0.1,300);
00070   // now to load the shader and set the values
00071   // grab an instance of shader manager
00072   ngl::ShaderLib *shader=ngl::ShaderLib::instance();
00073   // we are creating a shader called Phong
00074   shader->createShaderProgram("Phong");
00075   // now we are going to create empty shaders for Frag and Vert
00076   shader->attachShader("PhongVertex",ngl::VERTEX);
00077   shader->attachShader("PhongFragment",ngl::FRAGMENT);
00078   // attach the source
00079   shader->loadShaderSource("PhongVertex","shaders/PhongVertex.glsl");
00080   shader->loadShaderSource("PhongFragment","shaders/PhongFragment.glsl");
00081   // compile the shaders
00082   shader->compileShader("PhongVertex");
00083   shader->compileShader("PhongFragment");
00084   // add them to the program
00085   shader->attachShaderToProgram("Phong","PhongVertex");
00086   shader->attachShaderToProgram("Phong","PhongFragment");
00087   // now bind the shader attributes for most NGL primitives we use the following
00088   // layout attribute 0 is the vertex data (x,y,z)
00089   shader->bindAttribute("Phong",0,"inVert");
00090   // attribute 1 is the UV data u,v (if present)
00091   shader->bindAttribute("Phong",1,"inUV");
00092   // attribute 2 are the normals x,y,z
00093   shader->bindAttribute("Phong",2,"inNormal");
00094 
00095   // now we have associated this data we can link the shader
00096   shader->linkProgramObject("Phong");
00097   // and make it active ready to load values
00098   (*shader)["Phong"]->use();
00099   shader->setShaderParam1i("Normalize",1);
00100   shader->setShaderParam3f("viewerPos",m_camera->getEye().m_x,m_camera->getEye().m_y,m_camera->getEye().m_z);
00101   // now pass the modelView and projection values to the shader
00102   // the shader will use the currently active material and light0 so set them
00103   ngl::Material m(ngl::POLISHEDSILVER);
00104   m.loadToShader("material");
00105   // we need to set a base colour as the material isn't being used for all the params
00106   shader->setShaderParam4f("Colour",0.23125f,0.23125f,0.23125f,1);
00107 
00108   ngl::Light light(ngl::Vec3(2,2,2),ngl::Colour(1,1,1,1),ngl::Colour(1,1,1,1),ngl::POINTLIGHT);
00109   // now create our light this is done after the camera so we can pass the
00110   // transpose of the projection matrix to the light to do correct eye space
00111   // transformations
00112   ngl::Mat4 iv=m_camera->getViewMatrix();
00113   iv.transpose();
00114   light.setTransform(iv);
00115   light.setAttenuation(1,0,0);
00116   light.enable();
00117   // load these values to the shader as well
00118   light.loadToShader("light");
00119 
00120   ngl::VAOPrimitives *prim=ngl::VAOPrimitives::instance();
00121   prim->createSphere("sphere",1.0,40);
00122   m_text = new  ngl::Text(QFont("Arial",18));
00123   m_text->setScreenSize(this->size().width(),this->size().height());
00124 
00125   m_modelLOD = NULL;
00126   m_selectedModel = 0;
00127 
00128   glViewport(0,0,width()*devicePixelRatio(),height()*devicePixelRatio());
00129 }

void GLWindow::loadMatricesToShader (  )  [private]

method to load transform matrices to the shader

Definition at line 143 of file GLWindow.cpp.

References m_camera, and m_mouseGlobalTX.

00144 {
00145   ngl::ShaderLib *shader=ngl::ShaderLib::instance();
00146 
00147   ngl::Mat4 MV;
00148   ngl::Mat4 MVP;
00149   ngl::Mat3 normalMatrix;
00150   ngl::Mat4 M;
00151   M=m_mouseGlobalTX;
00152   MV=M*m_camera->getViewMatrix();
00153   MVP=M*m_camera->getVPMatrix() ;
00154   normalMatrix=MV;
00155   normalMatrix.inverse();
00156   shader->setShaderParamFromMat4("MV",MV);
00157   shader->setShaderParamFromMat4("MVP",MVP);
00158   shader->setShaderParamFromMat3("normalMatrix",normalMatrix);
00159   shader->setShaderParamFromMat4("M",M);
00160 }

void GLWindow::mouseMoveEvent ( QMouseEvent *  _event  )  [private]

this method is called every time a mouse is moved

Parameters:
_event the Qt Event structure

Definition at line 235 of file GLWindow.cpp.

References INCREMENT, m_modelPos, m_origX, m_origXPos, m_origY, m_origYPos, m_rotate, m_spinXFace, m_spinYFace, and m_translate.

00236 {
00237   // note the method buttons() is the button state when event was called
00238   // this is different from button() which is used to check which button was
00239   // pressed when the mousePress/Release event is generated
00240   if(m_rotate && _event->buttons() == Qt::LeftButton)
00241   {
00242     int diffx=_event->x()-m_origX;
00243     int diffy=_event->y()-m_origY;
00244     m_spinXFace += (float) 0.5f * diffy;
00245     m_spinYFace += (float) 0.5f * diffx;
00246     m_origX = _event->x();
00247     m_origY = _event->y();
00248     updateGL();
00249 
00250   }
00251         // right mouse translate code
00252   else if(m_translate && _event->buttons() == Qt::RightButton)
00253   {
00254     int diffX = (int)(_event->x() - m_origXPos);
00255     int diffY = (int)(_event->y() - m_origYPos);
00256     m_origXPos=_event->x();
00257     m_origYPos=_event->y();
00258     m_modelPos.m_x += INCREMENT * diffX;
00259     m_modelPos.m_y -= INCREMENT * diffY;
00260     updateGL();
00261 
00262    }
00263 }

_event the Qt Event structure

Definition at line 267 of file GLWindow.cpp.

References m_origX, m_origXPos, m_origY, m_origYPos, m_rotate, and m_translate.

00268 {
00269   // this method is called when the mouse button is pressed in this case we
00270   // store the value where the maouse was clicked (x,y) and set the Rotate flag to true
00271   if(_event->button() == Qt::LeftButton)
00272   {
00273     m_origX = _event->x();
00274     m_origY = _event->y();
00275     m_rotate =true;
00276   }
00277   // right mouse translate mode
00278   else if(_event->button() == Qt::RightButton)
00279   {
00280     m_origXPos = _event->x();
00281     m_origYPos = _event->y();
00282     m_translate=true;
00283   }
00284 
00285 
00286 }

00202 
00203 
00204   // Rotation based on the mouse position for our global transform
00205   ngl::Mat4 rotX;
00206   ngl::Mat4 rotY;
00207   // create the rotation matrices
00208   rotX.rotateX(m_spinXFace);
00209   rotY.rotateY(m_spinYFace);
00210   // multiply the rotations
00211   m_mouseGlobalTX=rotY*rotX;
00212   // add the translations
00213   m_mouseGlobalTX.m_m[3][0] = m_modelPos.m_x;
00214   m_mouseGlobalTX.m_m[3][1] = m_modelPos.m_y;
00215   m_mouseGlobalTX.m_m[3][2] = m_modelPos.m_z;
00216   loadMatricesToShader();
00217 
00218   if ( allModels.size() != 0 && allModels[m_selectedModel] != NULL )
00219     allModels[m_selectedModel]->draw();
00220 
00221   m_text->renderText(10,10,"LODGenerator");
00222 }
